remarks: Relation name chosen to capture functional link between text and belief system.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ancient Egyptian burial practices are grounded in ancient Egyptian afterlife beliefs.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
remarks: More inferential; created to capture the doctrinal basis of burial practices.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject practice or doctrine is conceptually grounded in or derived from the object belief system or set of concepts.
args.justification: Both relations link ancient Egyptian burial practices (subject) to ancient Egyptian afterlife beliefs (object) as their doctrinal or conceptual basis ("shaped by and expressed"; "grounded in"), indicating a dependency where practices are based on beliefs rather than merely associated.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject text, practice, or artifact functionally supports, articulates, or operates within the object belief system.
args.justification: This relation describes how the Book of the Dead functions within and supports ancient Egyptian afterlife beliefs by guiding the soul, which is a functional-support role toward the belief system rather than a dependency of the text on the beliefs.

Both relations capture that a religious or cultural practice (burial practices) depends conceptually on an underlying set of beliefs (afterlife beliefs), forming a coherent class of doctrinal or belief-based dependency relations.

The Book of the Dead relation highlights a text that functionally supports and operates within a belief system, fitting a class of relations where artifacts or texts reinforce, implement, or guide adherents within that system.
The semantics of "is_based_on" describe a conceptual/causal dependence where beliefs underpin and causally shape practices, fitting a causality-like group rather than mere association.

The Book of the Dead relation emphasizes the functional role of the text in guiding the soul and supporting the belief system, which is best grouped under functional/usage-oriented relations rather than strict causal or compositional ones.
